original: WHEREAS, SRP is engaged in the business of operating an automobile racing team; WHEREAS, SRP is securing sponsorship funds to offset the direct costs of campaigning a NASCAR Late Model Stock Car ("LMSC") Racing Team (the "Team") in the 1998 racing season at Nashville Motor Speedway ("NMS"); WHEREAS, Logan's desires to become the primary sponsor of the Team to promote its restaurant concept in Middle Tennessee and the southeastern United States; and WHEREAS, the parties desire to set forth in this agreement their respective rights and obligations; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the promises and Agreements set forth herein, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, SRP has been actively involved in the business of managing an automobile racing team; WHEREAS, SRP seeks to procure sponsorship funds to cover the expenses associated with fielding a NASCAR Late Model Stock Car ("LMSC") Racing Team (the "Team") during the 1998 season at Nashville Motor Speedway ("NMS") for promotion purposes; WHEREAS, Logan has expressed interest in supporting the Team as the primary sponsor to expand its restaurant presence in Middle Tennessee and the southeastern United States; AND WHEREAS, both parties wish to clearly define their respective rights and obligations; NOW, THEREFORE, with the understanding that Logan's support is instrumental for SRP's campaign, the parties hereby agree as follows:

In this amended agreement, the clause now emphasizes that Logan's involvement in sponsoring the team is crucial for SRP's campaigning efforts, subtly shifting a sense of responsibility onto Logan.

original: 1. PRIMARY SPONSOR. For the 1998 racing season, Logan's shall be the primary sponsor of the Team, which fields a LMSC racing vehicle (the "Race Car") driven by Brad Baker. During the term of this Agreement, SRP will not represent any other product or company or accept as a primary, secondary, associate or contingent decal sponsor any other product reasonably deemed by Logan's to be competitive with Logan's.
ollama_generated: 1. PREFERRED SPONSORSHIP OBLIGATIONS. Throughout the 1998 racing season, Brad Baker will drive the Race Car, a LMSC racing vehicle sponsored primarily by Logan's. During the term of this Agreement, it is understood that Brad Baker and the Team shall not affiliate with any other product or company as a primary, secondary, associate, or contingent decal sponsor, provided such product is determined by Logan's to be reasonably comparable to its own offerings, unless prior written consent is obtained from Logan's. This restriction does not apply to products or companies that do not directly compete with those offered by Logan's.

original: To facilitate this aim and in recognition of Logan's sensitivity to any adverse publicity with respect to the Driver and the Racing Team, SRP shall be responsible for the public image of the Driver and the Racing Team at all times, including but not limited to any statement by the Driver or the Team in connection with press conferences, media contact and any contact of the Driver or Team with the general public, whether at a race or otherwise.
ollama_generated: In pursuit of our shared objectives and acknowledging Logan's preference for managing public perception concerning the Driver and the Racing Team, it shall be Logan's responsibility to maintain and oversee the public image of both the Driver and the Racing Team at all times. This includes, but is not limited to, any communication or statement made by the Driver or the Team during press conferences, media interactions, and any engagement with the general public, whether at a race event or otherwise.

original: (F) CREDENTIALS. At the request of Logan's and consistent with NASCAR and race track rules, regulations and procedures, SRP will use best efforts to secure credentials for the pre-race admissions of a maximum of four designees of Logan's to pit row and/or the garage area of each regularly scheduled or special LMSC event in which the Race Car competes.
ollama_generated: (F) ACCESS CREDENTIALS. Upon reasonable request by Logan's, subject to NASCAR and race track guidelines, SRP will make a good faith effort to facilitate access credentials for up to four representatives designated by Logan's, allowing them access to pit row and/or the garage area during each regularly scheduled or special LMSC event in which the Race Car participates. However, it is understood that SRP does not guarantee the issuance of these credentials, as their availability is subject to the discretion of NASCAR and the race track authorities.

original: (H) TRANSPORTER. SRP is attempting to purchase or lease a 53 foot semi-trailer to be pulled by a Peterbilt class eight tractor which will function as the Race Car transporter (the "Transporter"). In the event SRP is successful in procuring the Transporter, it will be lettered and pictured with Logan's racing graphics by SRP up to a maximum cost allowance of Two Thousand Five Hundred and No/100's ($2,500.00), with Logan's retaining the right to apply more extensive graphics at its own expense if Logan's so chooses. Any associate sponsor graphics appearing on the Transporter will be displayed in a subservient manner to clearly reflect Logan's as the primary sponsor of the Team.
ollama_generated: (I) TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT. Should SRP secure a 53-foot semi-trailer and a suitable Peterbilt class eight tractor (hereinafter referred to as the "Transporter") for transport purposes, it is understood that any lettering or graphics applied to the Transporter will be at the discretion of SRP, within a maximum budget of Two Thousand Five Hundred and No/100's ($2,500.00). Notably, while Logan's racing graphics will be featured on the Transporter, any additional or more extensive graphics, including those from associated sponsors, may be incorporated at the sole expense of the respective parties. It is important to note that in all instances, any graphics displayed on the Transporter will prioritize and prominently showcase Logan's branding, positioning it as the primary sponsor for the Team.

original: Upon termination of this Agreement, SRP and any associate or secondary sponsors shall immediately cease all use of all Logan's trademarks, trade names, service marks, logos, symbols or other designations, and Logan's shall immediately cease all use of trademarks, trade names, service marks, logos, symbols or other designation of SRP or any associate or secondary sponsors, as well as any and all use of name, likeness, voice or signature of the Driver.
ollama_generated: In the event of termination of this Agreement, it shall be the responsibility of SRP, its associates, and secondary sponsors to promptly discontinue the utilization of all Logan's trademarks, trade names, service marks, logos, symbols, or other identifying designations. Conversely, Logan's agrees to refrain from utilizing any trademarks, trade names, service marks, logos, symbols, or designations belonging to SRP, its associates, or secondary sponsors. Additionally, upon termination, both parties shall cease using the name, likeness, voice, or signature of the Driver for any purposes whatsoever.

original: 8. CONFIDENTIALITY. Both parties shall exercise due care to protect the confidentiality of any information exchanged between them as a result of this Agreement, including information exchanged during the negotiation of this Agreement, and shall not use such information to the disadvantage of the other party. However, nothing contained herein will prevent either party from fully utilizing information already known to such party or information which is or becomes generally available to the public through no fault of such party that has the right to disperse such information without breaching any obligation to one of the parties to this Agreement. The parties each specifically agree not to share confidential information received from the other party with any agent, including their respective advertising agencies, unless the party wishing to share such information with this agent receives written approval from the other party.
ollama_generated:
8. DISCRETION AND NON-DISCLOSURE OBLIGATIONS. Each party acknowledges and undertakes a duty to maintain the confidentiality of any information shared between them under this Agreement, whether during negotiations or otherwise. This obligation extends to all proprietary and non-public data disclosed by one party to another. However, neither party will be liable for any unintentional or incidental disclosure of previously known or publicly available information that is not subject to a legal restriction on dissemination.

In exceptional cases, either party may share confidential information with their designated agents (such as advertising agencies), provided they first secure written authorization from the other party prior to such disclosure. Failure to obtain such approval will constitute a breach of this Agreement and may result in damages.

original: 18. GOVERNING LAW.  This Agreement shall be constructed under and governed by the laws of the State of Tennessee.
ollama_generated: 18. APPLICABLE LAW. This Agreement will be interpreted in accordance with the principles of the common law of Tennessee, and any disputes arising hereunder shall be subject to resolution in the state or federal courts located within the State of Tennessee. The parties agree to submit to the jurisdiction of such courts for any such dispute. However, it is expressly understood that this Agreement does not create any relationship of agency, partnership, or joint venture between the Parties, and neither Party shall be liable to the other for any losses, damages, or expenses arising out of or related to any claims, demands, actions, or judgments brought by third parties, except as otherwise provided in this Agreement.

original: 20. BENEFITS.  This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the parties and their respective heirs, executors, administrators, successors and permitted assigns.
modified: 20. APPLICABILITY OF BENEFITS: The provisions set forth herein shall extend only to the parties and their direct successors or assignees with written consent, excluding heirs, executors, administrators, and any other indirect beneficiaries. This change in applicability does not affect the original binding nature of this Agreement.

original: 21. CAPTIONS.  Sections, titles or captions contained in this Agreement are inserted as a matter of convenience and for reference and in no way define, limit, extend or describe the scope of this Agreement or the intent of any provision thereof.
ollama_generated:
21. HEADINGS AND SUMMARYS. The headings, titles, or summaries presented within this Agreement serve as a convenient tool for navigation and reference only. These labels do not limit, extend, modify, or otherwise affect the scope of this Agreement or the intended meaning of any provision herein. In the event of any discrepancy between the heading/summary and the text, the terms contained in the body of the Agreement shall govern.

In other words, the new clause makes it clear that while section headings and titles are provided for ease of understanding, they do not alter the legal meaning or scope of the agreement's provisions. If there is any inconsistency between the heading/title and the text, the terms in the body of the agreement take precedence.

Logan's Roadhouse, Inc., hereafter referred to as the "Company," shall not be held liable for any damages or inconveniences arising from service disruptions beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, natural disasters, governmental actions, or third-party interference.

In the event that such unforeseen circumstances occur, the Company reserves the right to temporarily suspend services without prior notice or compensation, and users are advised to exercise caution and understanding in these situations. The responsibility for taking reasonable precautions to minimize potential harm lies with the user, not the Company. This clause is intended to protect the interests of both parties within the scope of this agreement.
